10.author: [No author]

11.heading: Cremation.
11.title: "Kraken" p. 7-12 in Kraken, by Antonio Segura and Jordi Bernet
11.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: The surface police chase three robbers and kill one, but two escape into Sewer Three, out of their jurisdiction. Lieutenant Dante and the Subterranean Action Group take up the chase and kill the men. While fishing for the bodies they find an unexpected corpse, dead but still moving. Dante says that the Kraken has left a small part of itself to feed on the corpse, and that this is the Kraken's method of reproduction. He sends a red alert to all sections that the Kraken is in the sewers, and cremates the infected body.

12.heading: Cremation.
12.title: "Lest We Forget!"
12.author: by Major T
12.appears_in: E. Bowen. 10 p. in Wings Comics, no. 112 (1950) ; partial rewrite of untitled Captain Wings story in Wings Comics, no. 58 (June 1945).
notes: Summary: In an air battle, Captain Wings has killed Prince Yuima-Koji, the son of the Japanese emperor. Intelligence officer Madam Dragon asks for one last chance to capture Captain Wings. Posing as an exotic dancer she captures his men while they're off-duty in Katung, and drops one of them back at the base, dead but with a letter attached. Captain Wings is instructed to exchange himself for the rest of the men. It's a trap, at a temple in the country, but Captain Wings goes anyhow. Just as the men are about to be cremated alive in Prince Yuima-Koji's plane, Griper shows up, kills Madam Dragon and blows up the temple.

126.heading: Crépin, Thierry.
126.title: Haro sur le Gangster! : la Moralisation de la Presse Enfantine, 1934-1954
126.author: Thierry Crépin ; préface de Pascal Ory.
notes: In large part about French comics and their censorship.
MSU has a defective copy, lacking p. 38-39, 46-47, 50-51, 54-55, 62-63.

127.heading: Crépin, Thierry.
127.title: "1950-1954 : la Commission de Surveillance entre Intimidation et Répression"
127.author: Thierry Crépin
127.appears_in: p. 28-27 in 9e art : Les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 4 (Jan. 1999).
notes: (49-956 ou la Démoralisation de la Jeunesse : les 50 Ans de la Loi du 16 Juillet 1949)

Begins: "Les premières années au cours desquelles a siégé la Commission de surveillance et de contrôle des publications destinées à la jeunesse présentent un intérêt particulier: elles montrent la mise en place progressive d'une stratégie d'une 'jurisprudence'. Elles coïncident aussie avec la prise de conscience, par la Commission, des limites imposées à son pouvoir."

English summary (from page 142): "1950-1954: The Supvervision Committee, Intimidation and Repression. The law of '49 created a committee for the supervision of the children's press. This committee sends reports to the Ministry of Justice which can then take various censorial measures. It also puts pressure to bear on publishers to self-censor their production. Thierry Crépin has studied the first few years of its existence and shows how it progressively defined its strategy and discovered the limits of its power."

128.heading: Crépin, Thierry.
128.title: On Tue à Chaque Page : la loi de 1949 sur les publications destinées à la jeunesse
128.author: Christophe Chavdia, Michel Defourny, Stanislas Faure, Alain Fourment, Jean-Paul Gabilliet, Bernard Joubert, Françoise Levèque, Jean-Matthieu Méon, Jean-Yves Molier, Pascal Ory, Jean-Pierre Rioux, Patrick Wachsmann ; coordonné par Thierry Crépin et Thierry Groensteen.

publication info.publisher: Editions du temps ; Angoulême : Musée de la bande dessinée

notes: Note "À l'origine de cet ouvrage se trouve le colloque 'Cinquante ans de censure?', ... 30 janvier 1999 au Centre national de la bande dessinée et de l'image d'Angoulême."
On censorship of comics in France.
